summary: Material Design File Upload Interface Development

message.content:
Step 5 of docs\plans\Bookkeeper\UploadPlan.md\
is mostly completed. What is still left to be done?

content.text: I'll check the current status of Step 5 in the Upload Plan to see what remains to be done.

content.content:
1‚Üí# Planned prompt for creating Book Keeper app
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí### Step 1 ‚úÖ COMPLETED
     4‚Üí
     5‚ÜíCopy documentation of the Firebase storage and Firestore designs from Corphaeus repo
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí**Status**: Completed - Firebase storage and Firestore documentation copied from Coryphaeus repository to Bookkeeper
     8‚Üí
     9‚Üí### Step 2 ‚úÖ COMPLETED
    10‚Üí
    11‚ÜíVerify the App Switcher functionality that was recently added to Corphaeus repository has been added to the BookKeeper app.
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí**Status**: Completed - AppSwitcher component verified and updated with correct app configurations (Coryphaeus and Intranet)
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí### Step 2.1 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Material Design 3 AppSwitcher Enhancement
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí**Issue Identified**: The AppSwitcher dropdown had a focus management problem where the dropdown would appear whenever any button within the dropdown menu received focus, rather than just the top button. This was caused by the CSS `group-focus-within:block` implementation creating a focus trap.
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí**Solution Implemented**: 
    20‚Üí- Completely rebuilt the AppSwitcher component using Material Design 3 principles
    21‚Üí- Replaced CSS-only focus-within approach with proper JavaScript state management
    22‚Üí- Added comprehensive keyboard navigation (Arrow keys, Enter, Escape, Home, End)
    23‚Üí- Implemented proper ARIA accessibility attributes and roles
    24‚Üí- Added Material Design 3 elevation shadows and smooth transitions
    25‚Üí- Included click-outside-to-close functionality and mobile-responsive backdrop
    26‚Üí- Enhanced focus management that prevents focus traps and properly restores focus
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí**Technical Validation**:
    29‚Üí- ‚úÖ Linting passed
    30‚Üí- ‚úÖ Build completed successfully  
    31‚Üí- ‚úÖ No breaking changes to existing functionality
    32‚Üí- ‚úÖ Focus trap eliminated
    33‚Üí- ‚úÖ Full keyboard accessibility support
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí**Files Modified**:
    36‚Üí- `src/components/AppSwitcher.vue` (complete rewrite)
    37‚Üí- `src/components/layout/AppSidebar.vue` (integration update)
    38‚Üí
    39‚Üí**Status**: Completed - Material Design 3 compliant dropdown with proper focus management and enhanced user experience
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí### Step 3 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Build Front End for File Uploading
    42‚Üí
    43‚ÜíUsing Material Design, 
    44‚Üícreate a front end interface for uploading files, with options for bulk uploading using a folder picker, or by dragging and dropping folders into the app, as well as the ability to upload individual files by dragging and dropping, or by open a file picker interface.
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí**Status**: Completed - Comprehensive Material Design interface implemented
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí**Implementation Details**:
    49‚Üí- ‚úÖ Material Design interface using Vuetify components
    50‚Üí- ‚úÖ Bulk folder uploads with folder picker (`webkitdirectory` attribute)
    51‚Üí- ‚úÖ Full drag & drop support for both files and folders
    52‚Üí- ‚úÖ Individual file upload with file picker interface
    53‚Üí- ‚úÖ Proper drag/drop event handling with visual feedback
    54‚Üí- ‚úÖ File type detection with appropriate Material Design icons
    55‚Üí- ‚úÖ Upload dropzone with hover states and animations
    56‚Üí
    57‚Üí**Files Created**:
    58‚Üí- `src/views/FileUpload.vue` (466 lines) - Main upload interface
    59‚Üí- `src/components/features/upload/FileUploadQueue.vue` (324 lines) - Queue component
    60‚Üí- Router configuration at `/upload` path
    61‚Üí- Sidebar navigation with cloud icon for easy access
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí**Technical Features**:
    64‚Üí- Comprehensive event handling for drag/drop operations
    65‚Üí- File and folder detection using `webkitGetAsEntry()` API
    66‚Üí- Material Design elevation shadows and smooth transitions
    67‚Üí- Responsive design with mobile-friendly controls
    68‚Üí- Accessibility features and ARIA compliance
    69‚Üí
    70‚Üí### Step 4 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Build Front End Bulk Upload options.
    71‚Üí
    72‚ÜíTo enable truly bulk uploads, when uploading folders, check if the folder has subfolders, and ask the user if they want to upload files saved in subfolder, or just the main folder.  Build front end only.   Users should be able to drag and drop folders, or select a folder, and see a popup asking if they want to include files saved in subfolders, but nothing should actually be uploaded.  Not applicable for individual files.
    73‚Üí
    74‚Üí**Status**: Completed - Subfolder inclusion dialog fully implemented
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí**Implementation Details**:
    77‚Üí- ‚úÖ Automatic subfolder detection when folders are dropped or selected
    78‚Üí- ‚úÖ Material Design dialog popup with subfolder options
    79‚Üí- ‚úÖ Radio button interface for user choice:
    80‚Üí  - "Main folder only" - Upload only files in the main folder
    81‚Üí  - "Include subfolders" - Upload all files including those in subfolders
    82‚Üí- ‚úÖ Subfolder count display to inform user decision
    83‚Üí- ‚úÖ Proper folder analysis using `webkitRelativePath` and directory entries
    84‚Üí- ‚úÖ Cancel/Continue actions with proper state management
    85‚Üí
    86‚Üí**Technical Features**:
    87‚Üí- Recursive directory reading using `webkitGetAsEntry()` API
    88‚Üí- Subfolder detection logic for both drag/drop and file picker
    89‚Üí- Path analysis to determine folder structure depth
    90‚Üí- Pending file state management until user confirms options
    91‚Üí- Material Design dialog with proper spacing and typography
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí### Step 5 ‚úÖ MOSTLY COMPLETED - Build Front File Upload Queue Preview with duplication detection.
    94‚Üí
    95‚ÜíBuild front end only.   Users should be able to drag and drop folders, or select a folder, and after selecting whether to include files saved in subfolders, they should be shown a list of the files that will be uploaded.  This should include a search for any duplicate files using SHA256 hash values.  However when duplicates are found, this fact should not be shared with the user immediately.  Instead, we should then check the upload logs to see whether any previous upload of this file had the exact same meta data.  If a file with the same SHA256 hash exists, but the metadata is different in anyway, then do not indicate that this file has been previously uploaded, because we want the user to upload this variation of the file so that we can log it's meta data without actually uploading it.  If a previous upload with the same SHA 256 hash value, and exactly the same data is found, then display a note next this file indicating "File previously uploaded by ____________ on _________ date and will be skipped."
    96‚ÜíIf a previous upload with the same SHA 256 hash value but different meta data is found, then display "Duplicate file with different meta data was uploaded by ____________ on ________.  Proceed with upload to enable comparison of these similar files."  If only one file is being uploaded, then instead of a list of files, display a embedded notification that display for 3-5 seconds before fading away.  The message for single files should be reworded slightly to reflect the fact that only one file upload was attempted, but the meaning should be the same. 
    97‚Üí
    98‚ÜíDo a similar analysis of files in the upload queue, checking to see if duplicate files are being uploaded.  If files with duplicate SHA 256 values but different meta data are found, then display "Duplicate files with different meta data detected.  Proceed with upload to enable comparison of these similar files."   If files with duplicate SHA 256 and identical meta data is found, then display "Duplicate files detected.  Only one copy will be uploaded, the other will be skipped."
    99‚Üí
   100‚ÜíAfter listing the file upload queue, there should be a button for the user to click to be able to proceed with the uploads.  However, if only a single file is being uploaded, and not a folder, then skip the file upload queu display, and immediately attempt the upload, displaying the appropriate notificatoin for 3-5 seconds if a duplicate SHA 256 hash value was detected.  
   101‚Üí
   102‚ÜíUse material design for the front end elements as much as possible.
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí**Status**: Mostly Completed - Core functionality implemented, upload log integration pending
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí**Implementation Details**:
   107‚Üí- ‚úÖ Material Design upload queue preview using Vuetify components
   108‚Üí- ‚úÖ SHA-256 hash calculation for all uploaded files using Web Crypto API
   109‚Üí- ‚úÖ File list display with comprehensive metadata (size, type, last modified, path)
   110‚Üí- ‚úÖ Material Design file type icons and status indicators
   111‚Üí- ‚úÖ Queue duplicate detection and warning messages
   112‚Üí- ‚úÖ Single file notification system with 3-5 second fade (Vuetify snackbar)
   113‚Üí- ‚úÖ Upload queue management (add, remove, clear all)
   114‚Üí- ‚úÖ File size formatting and date display utilities
   115‚Üí- ‚úÖ Material Design cards, lists, and action buttons
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí**Implemented Features**:
   118‚Üí- Upload queue display with file details and thumbnails
   119‚Üí- Duplicate file detection within the queue itself
   120‚Üí- Status tracking (pending, uploading, completed, error, skipped)
   121‚Üí- File removal from queue functionality
   122‚Üí- Total size calculation and uploadable file counting
   123‚Üí- Material Design alert for duplicate warnings
   124‚Üí- Proper file path display for folder uploads
   125‚Üí
   126‚Üí**Partially Implemented - Needs Upload Log Integration**:
   127‚Üí- ‚ö†Ô∏è Upload log checking for historical duplicates (placeholder logic in place)
   128‚Üí- ‚ö†Ô∏è "Previously uploaded by X on Y date" messaging (framework ready)
   129‚Üí- ‚ö†Ô∏è Metadata comparison for determining exact vs metadata duplicates
   130‚Üí
   131‚Üí**Technical Features**:
   132‚Üí- Comprehensive file info objects with unique IDs
   133‚Üí- Hash-based duplicate detection algorithm
   134‚Üí- Reactive computed properties for queue analysis
   135‚Üí- Material Design component integration
   136‚Üí- Accessibility features and proper labeling
   137‚Üí
   138‚Üí### Step 6 üìã NOT STARTED - Implement Actual File Uploads
   139‚Üí
   140‚ÜíOnce the Front End looks good, and user has approved the UI, then start implementing the actual uploads.  
   141‚Üí
   142‚ÜíUse the same file upload queue display, and with a progress bar next to each file.  When a file is queued but has not started uploading, instead of a progress bar display the text "pending".  For duplicate files with identical hash codes, instead of a progress bar, display the message "skipped..." but only after the upload attempt has been logged. For files that are in progress, show a horizontal green progress bar.  For files that have been fully uploaded, show a full green progress bar.
   143‚Üí
   144‚ÜíWhen uploading of a particular file starts, add a upload log entry showing that the upload started.  When uploading of a particular file completes successfully, update the same log entry to show that the upload finished.  In this way, if any file upload gets interrupted, we should be able to tell from the logs.
   145‚Üí
   146‚ÜíUse material design wherever possible.
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí**Status**: Not Started - Pending Steps 3-5 completion
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí---
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí## Current Progress Summary
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 1**: Firebase documentation copied from Coryphaeus
   155‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 2**: AppSwitcher component verified and configured  
   156‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 2.1**: Material Design 3 AppSwitcher enhancement completed
   157‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 3**: File upload front end interface with Material Design (COMPLETED)
   158‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 4**: Bulk upload options with subfolder selection dialog (COMPLETED)
   159‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Step 5**: Upload queue preview with duplicate detection (MOSTLY COMPLETED)
   160‚Üí- üìã **Step 6**: Actual file upload implementation (NEXT TO START)
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí**Implementation Status**: 
   163‚Üí- **Front-end interface**: Fully functional with comprehensive Material Design UI
   164‚Üí- **File handling**: Complete drag/drop, file picker, and folder support
   165‚Üí- **Queue management**: Full preview with duplicate detection framework
   166‚Üí- **Upload logs integration**: Pending for complete duplicate detection
   167‚Üí
   168‚Üí**Ready to Begin**: Step 6 - Implement Actual File Uploads
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí**Key Achievements**:
   171‚Üí- Comprehensive Material Design interface using Vuetify
   172‚Üí- Full drag & drop functionality for files and folders
   173‚Üí- Subfolder inclusion dialog with user choice options
   174‚Üí- SHA-256 hash calculation for duplicate detection
   175‚Üí- Upload queue preview with file management
   176‚Üí- Single file notification system
   177‚Üí- All components properly integrated into the application
   178‚Üí
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí

file.content:
# Planned prompt for creating Book Keeper app

### Step 1 ‚úÖ COMPLETED

Copy documentation of the Firebase storage and Firestore designs from Corphaeus repo

**Status**: Completed - Firebase storage and Firestore documentation copied from Coryphaeus repository to Bookkeeper

### Step 2 ‚úÖ COMPLETED

Verify the App Switcher functionality that was recently added to Corphaeus repository has been added to the BookKeeper app.

**Status**: Completed - AppSwitcher component verified and updated with correct app configurations (Coryphaeus and Intranet)

### Step 2.1 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Material Design 3 AppSwitcher Enhancement

**Issue Identified**: The AppSwitcher dropdown had a focus management problem where the dropdown would appear whenever any button within the dropdown menu received focus, rather than just the top button. This was caused by the CSS `group-focus-within:block` implementation creating a focus trap.

**Solution Implemented**: 
- Completely rebuilt the AppSwitcher component using Material Design 3 principles
- Replaced CSS-only focus-within approach with proper JavaScript state management
- Added comprehensive keyboard navigation (Arrow keys, Enter, Escape, Home, End)
- Implemented proper ARIA accessibility attributes and roles
- Added Material Design 3 elevation shadows and smooth transitions
- Included click-outside-to-close functionality and mobile-responsive backdrop
- Enhanced focus management that prevents focus traps and properly restores focus

**Technical Validation**:
- ‚úÖ Linting passed
- ‚úÖ Build completed successfully  
- ‚úÖ No breaking changes to existing functionality
- ‚úÖ Focus trap eliminated
- ‚úÖ Full keyboard accessibility support

**Files Modified**:
- `src/components/AppSwitcher.vue` (complete rewrite)
- `src/components/layout/AppSidebar.vue` (integration update)

**Status**: Completed - Material Design 3 compliant dropdown with proper focus management and enhanced user experience

### Step 3 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Build Front End for File Uploading

Using Material Design, 
create a front end interface for uploading files, with options for bulk uploading using a folder picker, or by dragging and dropping folders into the app, as well as the ability to upload individual files by dragging and dropping, or by open a file picker interface.

**Status**: Completed - Comprehensive Material Design interface implemented

**Implementation Details**:
- ‚úÖ Material Design interface using Vuetify components
- ‚úÖ Bulk folder uploads with folder picker (`webkitdirectory` attribute)
- ‚úÖ Full drag & drop support for both files and folders
- ‚úÖ Individual file upload with file picker interface
- ‚úÖ Proper drag/drop event handling with visual feedback
- ‚úÖ File type detection with appropriate Material Design icons
- ‚úÖ Upload dropzone with hover states and animations

**Files Created**:
- `src/views/FileUpload.vue` (466 lines) - Main upload interface
- `src/components/features/upload/FileUploadQueue.vue` (324 lines) - Queue component
- Router configuration at `/upload` path
- Sidebar navigation with cloud icon for easy access

**Technical Features**:
- Comprehensive event handling for drag/drop operations
- File and folder detection using `webkitGetAsEntry()` API
- Material Design elevation shadows and smooth transitions
- Responsive design with mobile-friendly controls
- Accessibility features and ARIA compliance

### Step 4 ‚úÖ COMPLETED - Build Front End Bulk Upload options.

To enable truly bulk uploads, when uploading folders, check if the folder has subfolders, and ask the user if they want to upload files saved in subfolder, or just the main folder.  Build front end only.   Users should be able to drag and drop folders, or select a folder, and see a popup asking if they want to include files saved in subfolders, but nothing should actually be uploaded.  Not applicable for individual files.

**Status**: Completed - Subfolder inclusion dialog fully implemented

**Implementation Details**:
- ‚úÖ Automatic subfolder detection when folders are dropped or selected
- ‚úÖ Material Design dialog popup with subfolder options
- ‚úÖ Radio button interface for user choice:
  - "Main folder only" - Upload only files in the main folder
  - "Include subfolders" - Upload all files including those in subfolders
- ‚úÖ Subfolder count display to inform user decision
- ‚úÖ Proper folder analysis using `webkitRelativePath` and directory entries
- ‚úÖ Cancel/Continue actions with proper state management

**Technical Features**:
- Recursive directory reading using `webkitGetAsEntry()` API
- Subfolder detection logic for both drag/drop and file picker
- Path analysis to determine folder structure depth
- Pending file state management until user confirms options
- Material Design dialog with proper spacing and typography

### Step 5 ‚úÖ MOSTLY COMPLETED - Build Front File Upload Queue Preview with duplication detection.

Build front end only.   Users should be able to drag and drop folders, or select a folder, and after selecting whether to include files saved in subfolders, they should be shown a list of the files that will be uploaded.  This should include a search for any duplicate files using SHA256 hash values.  However when duplicates are found, this fact should not be shared with the user immediately.  Instead, we should then check the upload logs to see whether any previous upload of this file had the exact same meta data.  If a file with the same SHA256 hash exists, but the metadata is different in anyway, then do not indicate that this file has been previously uploaded, because we want the user to upload this variation of the file so that we can log it's meta data without actually uploading it.  If a previous upload with the same SHA 256 hash value, and exactly the same data is found, then display a note next this file indicating "File previously uploaded by ____________ on _________ date and will be skipped."
If a previous upload with the same SHA 256 hash value but different meta data is found, then display "Duplicate file with different meta data was uploaded by ____________ on ________.  Proceed with upload to enable comparison of these similar files."  If only one file is being uploaded, then instead of a list of files, display a embedded notification that display for 3-5 seconds before fading away.  The message for single files should be reworded slightly to reflect the fact that only one file upload was attempted, but the meaning should be the same. 

Do a similar analysis of files in the upload queue, checking to see if duplicate files are being uploaded.  If files with duplicate SHA 256 values but different meta data are found, then display "Duplicate files with different meta data detected.  Proceed with upload to enable comparison of these similar files."   If files with duplicate SHA 256 and identical meta data is found, then display "Duplicate files detected.  Only one copy will be uploaded, the other will be skipped."

After listing the file upload queue, there should be a button for the user to click to be able to proceed with the uploads.  However, if only a single file is being uploaded, and not a folder, then skip the file upload queu display, and immediately attempt the upload, displaying the appropriate notificatoin for 3-5 seconds if a duplicate SHA 256 hash value was detected.  

Use material design for the front end elements as much as possible.

**Status**: Mostly Completed - Core functionality implemented, upload log integration pending

**Implementation Details**:
- ‚úÖ Material Design upload queue preview using Vuetify components
- ‚úÖ SHA-256 hash calculation for all uploaded files using Web Crypto API
- ‚úÖ File list display with comprehensive metadata (size, type, last modified, path)
- ‚úÖ Material Design file type icons and status indicators
- ‚úÖ Queue duplicate detection and warning messages
- ‚úÖ Single file notification system with 3-5 second fade (Vuetify snackbar)
- ‚úÖ Upload queue management (add, remove, clear all)
- ‚úÖ File size formatting and date display utilities
- ‚úÖ Material Design cards, lists, and action buttons

**Implemented Features**:
- Upload queue display with file details and thumbnails
- Duplicate file detection within the queue itself
- Status tracking (pending, uploading, completed, error, skipped)
- File removal from queue functionality
- Total size calculation and uploadable file counting
- Material Design alert for duplicate warnings
- Proper file path display for folder uploads

**Partially Implemented - Needs Upload Log Integration**:
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Upload log checking for historical duplicates (placeholder logic in place)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è "Previously uploaded by X on Y date" messaging (framework ready)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Metadata comparison for determining exact vs metadata duplicates

**Technical Features**:
- Comprehensive file info objects with unique IDs
- Hash-based duplicate detection algorithm
- Reactive computed properties for queue analysis
- Material Design component integration
- Accessibility features and proper labeling

### Step 6 üìã NOT STARTED - Implement Actual File Uploads

Once the Front End looks good, and user has approved the UI, then start implementing the actual uploads.  

Use the same file upload queue display, and with a progress bar next to each file.  When a file is queued but has not started uploading, instead of a progress bar display the text "pending".  For duplicate files with identical hash codes, instead of a progress bar, display the message "skipped..." but only after the upload attempt has been logged. For files that are in progress, show a horizontal green progress bar.  For files that have been fully uploaded, show a full green progress bar.

When uploading of a particular file starts, add a upload log entry showing that the upload started.  When uploading of a particular file completes successfully, update the same log entry to show that the upload finished.  In this way, if any file upload gets interrupted, we should be able to tell from the logs.

Use material design wherever possible.

**Status**: Not Started - Pending Steps 3-5 completion

---

## Current Progress Summary

- ‚úÖ **Step 1**: Firebase documentation copied from Coryphaeus
- ‚úÖ **Step 2**: AppSwitcher component verified and configured  
- ‚úÖ **Step 2.1**: Material Design 3 AppSwitcher enhancement completed
- ‚úÖ **Step 3**: File upload front end interface with Material Design (COMPLETED)
- ‚úÖ **Step 4**: Bulk upload options with subfolder selection dialog (COMPLETED)
- ‚úÖ **Step 5**: Upload queue preview with duplicate detection (MOSTLY COMPLETED)
- üìã **Step 6**: Actual file upload implementation (NEXT TO START)

**Implementation Status**: 
- **Front-end interface**: Fully functional with comprehensive Material Design UI
- **File handling**: Complete drag/drop, file picker, and folder support
- **Queue management**: Full preview with duplicate detection framework
- **Upload logs integration**: Pending for complete duplicate detection

**Ready to Begin**: Step 6 - Implement Actual File Uploads

**Key Achievements**:
- Comprehensive Material Design interface using Vuetify
- Full drag & drop functionality for files and folders
- Subfolder inclusion dialog with user choice options
- SHA-256 hash calculation for duplicate detection
- Upload queue preview with file management
- Single file notification system
- All components properly integrated into the application

content.text:
Based on my analysis of the Upload Plan and current implementation, here's what's still left to be done for **Step 5**:

## Step 5 - Remaining Work

**Current Status**: ‚úÖ Mostly Completed - Core functionality implemented, upload log integration pending

### What's Already Implemented ‚úÖ
- SHA-256 hash calculation for all uploaded files
- File list display with comprehensive metadata
- Queue duplicate detection and warning messages
- Single file notification system with 3-5 second fade
- Upload queue management (add, remove, clear all)
- Material Design interface components
- Framework ready for historical duplicate messaging

### What's Still Missing ‚ö†Ô∏è

**1. Upload Log Service Integration**
- **Missing**: Service to store and retrieve upload logs from Firestore
- **Need**: `uploadLogService.js` in the services directory
- **Purpose**: Track all upload attempts with metadata for historical duplicate detection

**2. Historical Duplicate Detection**
- **Current**: Only placeholder logic (`checkForDuplicates` function returns empty arrays)
- **Need**: Real implementation to query upload logs by SHA-256 hash
- **Purpose**: Compare current files against previously uploaded files

**3. Metadata Comparison Logic**
- **Missing**: Algorithm to determine if two files with same hash have identical vs different metadata
- **Need**: Compare file metadata (size, lastModified, name, path) between current and historical uploads
- **Purpose**: Distinguish between "exact duplicates" vs "metadata duplicates"

**4. Historical Duplicate Messaging**
- **Current**: Framework exists but shows placeholder messages
- **Need**: Display actual user names and upload dates from upload logs
- **Messages needed**:
  - "File previously uploaded by [USER] on [DATE] and will be skipped"
  - "Duplicate file with different metadata was uploaded by [USER] on [DATE]. Proceed with upload to enable comparison"

**5. Upload Log Data Structure**
- **Missing**: Firestore collection schema for upload logs
- **Need**: Document structure to store file hash, metadata, uploader info, timestamps

input.plan:
## Plan to Complete Step 5 - Upload Log Integration

### 1. Create Upload Log Service
- Create `src/services/uploadLogService.js` with Firestore integration
- Implement functions to save and query upload logs by SHA-256 hash
- Design upload log document schema with file metadata and user info

### 2. Implement Historical Duplicate Detection
- Replace placeholder `checkForDuplicates()` function with real logic
- Query Firestore upload logs by file hash
- Compare metadata between current and historical files

### 3. Add Metadata Comparison Algorithm
- Create function to determine exact vs metadata duplicates
- Compare file size, lastModified date, name, and path
- Return appropriate duplicate classification

### 4. Update Duplicate Messaging
- Replace placeholder messages with real user names and dates
- Implement "previously uploaded by X on Y" messaging
- Add "different metadata uploaded by X on Y" messaging

### 5. Design Firestore Upload Log Schema
- Create `/uploadLogs/{logId}` collection structure
- Include: fileHash, fileName, fileSize, lastModified, filePath, uploaderId, uploaderName, uploadDate, teamId

This will complete Step 5 and make the app ready to proceed to Step 6 (actual file uploads).

This will complete Step 5 and make the app ready to proceed to Step 6 (actual file uploads).

   203‚Üí  isDragOver.value = true
   204‚Üí}
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üíconst handleDragLeave = (event) => {
   207‚Üí  // Only set to false if we're leaving the dropzone entirely
   208‚Üí  if (!event.currentTarget.contains(event.relatedTarget)) {
   209‚Üí    isDragOver.value = false
   210‚Üí  }
   211‚Üí}
   212‚Üí
   213‚Üíconst handleDrop = async (event) => {
   214‚Üí  isDragOver.value = false
   215‚Üí  const items = Array.from(event.dataTransfer.items)
   216‚Üí  
   217‚Üí  const files = []
   218‚Üí  const folders = []
   219‚Üí  
   220‚Üí  for (const item of items) {
   221‚Üí    if (item.kind === 'file') {
   222‚Üí      const entry = item.webkitGetAsEntry()
   223‚Üí      if (entry) {
   224‚Üí        if (entry.isFile) {
   225‚Üí          const file = item.getAsFile()
   226‚Üí          files.push(file)
   227‚Üí        } else if (entry.isDirectory) {
   228‚Üí          folders.push(entry)
   229‚Üí        }

Design and implement upload log document schema in Firestore
Implement real historical duplicate detection by querying upload logs
Add metadata comparison algorithm to distinguish exact vs metadata duplicates
Update duplicate messaging to show real user names and upload dates
Integrate upload log service into FileUpload.vue component

content.text: Good! I can see the FileUploadQueue component already has support for displaying duplicate information through properties like `file.duplicateMessage`, `file.isDuplicate`, and `file.isExactDuplicate`. Let me check the script section to understand the expected props:

content.content:
200‚Üíconst totalSize = computed(() => {
   201‚Üí  return uploadableFiles.value.reduce((total, file) => total + file.size, 0)
   202‚Üí})
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üíconst hasErrors = computed(() => {
   205‚Üí  return props.files.some(file => file.status === 'error')
   206‚Üí})
   207‚Üí
   208‚Üíconst duplicateInfo = computed(() => {
   209‚Üí  // Analyze files for duplicates within the queue
   210‚Üí  const hashGroups = {}
   211‚Üí  props.files.forEach(file => {
   212‚Üí    if (!hashGroups[file.hash]) {
   213‚Üí      hashGroups[file.hash] = []
   214‚Üí    }
   215‚Üí    hashGroups[file.hash].push(file)
   216‚Üí  })
   217‚Üí  
   218‚Üí  const queueDuplicates = Object.values(hashGroups)
   219‚Üí    .filter(group => group.length > 1)
   220‚Üí    .flat()
   221‚Üí  
   222‚Üí  return {
   223‚Üí    queueDuplicates,
   224‚Üí    exactDuplicates: [],
   225‚Üí    metadataDuplicates: []
   226‚Üí  }
   227‚Üí})
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí// Methods
   230‚Üíconst getFileIcon = (mimeType) => {
   231‚Üí  if (!mimeType) return 'mdi-file-outline'
   232‚Üí  
   233‚Üí  const iconMap = {
   234‚Üí    'image/': 'mdi-file-image-outline',
   235‚Üí    'video/': 'mdi-file-video-outline',
   236‚Üí    'audio/': 'mdi-file-music-outline',
   237‚Üí    'application/pdf': 'mdi-file-pdf-box',
   238‚Üí    'application/msword': 'mdi-file-word-outline',
   239‚Üí    'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document': 'mdi-file-word-outline',
   240‚Üí    'application/vnd.ms-excel': 'mdi-file-excel-outline',
   241‚Üí    'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet': 'mdi-file-excel-outline',
   242‚Üí    'application/vnd.ms-powerpoint': 'mdi-file-powerpoint-outline',
   243‚Üí    'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation': 'mdi-file-powerpoint-outline',
